Upcoming Events

Dive deeper into art and join us for one of these upcoming events or programs.

View Calendar
Jan 15, 2026

After Hours with Pissarro

Join curator Angelica Daneo for an exclusive after hours tour of Pissarro's Impressionism.
Jan 16, 2026

Southwest Impressions: A Broader Perspective

Consider an array of American printmakers’ stories and techniques from the late 1800s into the mid-1900s at this year's annual PIWAA Symposium.
Sundays, Tuesdays, Thursdays, and Saturdays; times vary

Public Tours

Join specially trained docents for exhibitons, architecture, and 3 in 30 guided tours.
Occurs monthly on Tuesday.
Next is Jan 20, 2026

Mindful Looking

Mindful Looking invites you to slow down and spend time with a single work of art.
Jan 27, 2026

Mindful Looking Online

Mindful Looking invites you to slow down and spend time with a single work of art.
Jan 27, 2026

Anderman Photography Lecture: Making an Impression

Jan 30, 2026

Untitled: Artist Takeover January 2026

Artists take over the museum for a special night of interactive programs and one-of-a-kind experiences.
Jan 31, 2026

The Stars Watch From Long Ago Film Screening

Join us for the world premiere of The Stars Watch From Long Ago and discussion afterward.
Occurs monthly on Tuesday.
Next is Feb 3, 2026

Drop-In Drawing with Anna Kaye

Immerse yourself in the art-filled atmosphere of our museum with an in-person drawing session with artist Anna Kaye.
Feb 3, 2026

Rembrandt: The Greatest Artist of All Time?

Rembrandt expert Epco Runia discusses the areas in which Rembrandt excelled, from his experimental painting style, exciting lighting, and lively portraits, to his ability to convey deep emotions.
Feb 6, 2026

Quarterly Wine Pairings Dinner at The Ponti

Enjoy a special four-course dinner with wine pairings, explained in detail following each serving.
Feb 7, 2026

Paints & Pigments: A Colorful History

Investigate paints and pigments from earth to lab to canvas, uncovering stories of innovation, industrialization, and globalization along the way.
Feb 10, 2026

Free Day at the DAM

Engage with art, experience onsite activities, and explore the art on view all while enjoying free general admission!
Feb 10, 2026

Logan Lecture: Andrea Carlson

Join mixed-media artist Andrea Carlson and curator Rory Padeken for a wide-ranging conversation about her process, inspiration, and influences.
Occurs monthly on Thursday.
Next is Feb 12, 2026

Art & About

Designed for visitors with early-stage Alzheimer's or dementia and their care partners, experience art while led by a specially trained guide.
Occurs monthly on Saturday.
Next is Feb 14, 2026

Architecture Tours

Take a docent-led tour exploring the architecture of the museum campus!
Occurs monthly on Thursday.
Next is Feb 19, 2026

Create & Play

Create & Play is an early-childhood program offering a range of activities and interactive experiences for the whole family.
Feb 21, 2026

Poetry Slam with Slam Nuba

Join us for our annual Poetry Slam/open mic program, in collaboration with Slam Nuba.

Creative Classes

The next semester of Creative Classes are now on sale! Choose between painting, drawing, mixed media, and textile classes and resolve to be more creative in 2026.

Learn more
Jan 24, 2026

Papercraft: Hand Papermaking

Learn how to make paper from recycled materials.
Jan 31, 2026

Painting: Impressionist Inspired Watercolor

Learn how Impressionists captured light, color, and shadow in their paintings.
Feb 7, 2026

The Traditional Japanese Art of Bonseki

Learn the practice of arranging white sand, stones, and small tools on black lacquer trays to create miniature landscapes.
February 10–March 3, 2026 - 5:30-7:30 pm

Textiles: Introduction to Crochet

Learn the basic tools, tips, and tricks needed for the art of crochet.
February 12–March 5, 2026 - 10 am–12 pm

Painting: Introduction to Oil

Get an introduction to the materials and techniques of oil painting.
February 21 & 28, 2026 - 10 am–2 pm

Textiles: Personal Truth Tapestries

Create unique, personal, free verse tapestries inspired by Tracey Emin’s work.
February 26–April 2, 2026 - 1:30-4 pm

Papercraft: Book Arts

Learn hands-on techniques in papercraft and book arts through the lens of modern art and cross-cultural traditions.
Mar 7, 2026

Parfleche Painting: Plains Indians Design

Explore the Indigenous design practice of parfleche.
March 17–April 7, 2026 - 5:30-7:30 pm

Drawing: Introduction to Ink Mediums

Explore tools and techniques for making dynamic drawings with ink and brushes.
March 19–April 9, 2026 - 10 am-12 pm

Drawing: Nature Journaling

Explore the link between creativity and drawing and the natural world.
Mar 21, 2026

Abstract Collage: The Art of Intuitive Flow

Explore the power of shape, color, texture to evoke emotion and tell stories without explicit narratives.
Apr 4, 2026

Parfleche Painting: Plains Indians Design

Explore the Indigenous design practice of parfleche.
April 16–May 21, 2026 - 1:30-4 pm

Painting: Abstract Multiples in Acrylic

Abandon the idea of working on just one painting at a time and dive into creating many at once.
Apr 18, 2026

The Traditional Japanese Art of Bonseki

Learn the practice of arranging white sand, stones, and small tools on black lacquer trays to create miniature landscapes.
April 21–May 12, 2026 - 5:30-7:30 pm

Painting: Flow State

Explore the connections between intuitive painting, mindfulness, and community.
April 23–May 14, 2026 - 10 am–12 pm

Painting: Introduction to Watercolor

Learn a variety of watercolor techniques and experiment with the ways watercolor interacts with other media.
May 2, 2026

Drawing: Exploring Unconventional Tools

Create tools and play with a variety of unusual materials to draw unique works on paper.
May 16 & 23, 2026 - 10 am–2 pm

Drawing: Discovering Butterflies

Join the Butterfly Pavilion and the Denver Art Museum for a two-part artistic adventure!

News from the Blog

Catch up with the latest news and updates from the museum.

View blog

Creative Rituals for Self Care

Artist Sarah Darlene discusses how creativity and mindfulness can help you stay grounded.

Plan Your Visit to Pissarro's Impressionism

Tickets, dining, parking, and other info to enhance your trip to the museum.

The Black Arts Collective

This group was launched in 2023 to further strengthen the museum’s collection with acquisitions by Black artists.

Designing for Accessibility: Year One Update

An overview of the goals we've accomplished so far and the work that will come next.

Camille Pissarro Fathered a Family & Impressionism

Camille Pissarro may be known as the “father of Impressionism,” but his role as father to his children was vitally important to the artist.

More than Mere Returns: Restitution and Repair Work at the Denver Art Museum

Invest in Art & Culture for Future Generations

Make a planned gift to help sustain the museum for years to come.

Monica Curiel Discusses Her La Mari Chair

The artist recently spoke with the DAM about her work and the interactions between art, design, and her family and cultural identity.

Ugly Crying in the Art Museum

I had entered the museum with certain expectations.... What I found was so much more than I could have dreamed.

Explore Three Artworks in 30 Minutes

3 in 30 Tours highlight how unexpected connections between artworks can spark new ideas and perspectives.

A Wall That Speaks: ¿Being Home? by Rupprecht Matthies

Rupprecht Matthies’ installation ¿Being Home? invites visitors to reflect on the concept of "home" through a vibrant garden of words.

Artist David Huffman's Provo Soul

The artist layers references to progressive Black politics, Afrofuturism, Pop art, basketball, and Soul Train.

From Stress Relief to Reduced Inflammation: The Powerful Benefits of Awe

Vance Kirkland & the Art of Space

The artist created numerous series of paintings inspired by his love of the cosmos.

Gifts of Art: Frederick and Jan Mayer’s Lasting Impact

Learn about an atrial cross and a painting in our Latin American art collection.

A New View: Charles Harrison’s View-Master

The DAM recently acquired this iconic object, highlighting Harrison’s lasting influence on everyday design.

Words and Images Come Alive

Unlike most books that rely exclusively on two dimensions—letters printed on the page—Mesoamerican codices existed in three dimensions.

Preparing for Sustained!

Learn how we are working with Indigenous communities for this exhibition.

Conservation of Calligraphy Waterfall

Learn how a little bit of cleaning, repairing, and retouching transformed and stabilized a breathtaking and daring artwork.

Sons of the Sun by Teri Greeves

Watch a video with the artist and check out a Google Arts & Culture feature to learn more.

Philosophy in Fabric: Galih Podo by Batik Artist Sapuan

Learn about this Javanese textile on view in Weaving a Foundation: Cornerstones of the Textile Arts Collection.

Discover More as a Member

Membership unlocks access to more than ever before! As a member you'll enjoy daily free general admission, discounts at the Shop and on ticketed exhibitions, guest passes to share with family and friends, a subscription to our bimonthly member magazine, and so much more.

Become a member today and know that your support helps your Denver Art Museum preserve and share our collection for all to enjoy.

Learn more

Free for Kids

All visitors 18 and under enjoy free general admission to the museum every day, thanks to the Free for Kids program presented by Bellco Credit Union. Explore our online calendar and our family programs to help map out your fun on your next visit.

View CalendarView Family Programs

Eat at The Ponti

The Ponti, located in the Sie Welcome Center of the Martin Building, combines art with dining to present a locally-sourced and seasonally-inspired menu. Come for lunch on weekdays, brunch on the weekends, and dinner on Tuesday and Friday nights. A museum ticket is not required to dine at The Ponti.

Follow The Ponti's Instagram account (@thepontidenver) for information about giveaways, new additions to the menu, and more.

Learn more

Stop by the Shops

Bring a piece of the museum home with you! Stop by the shops during regular museum hours or shop online now to find unique art-inspired products, including jewelry, home goods, books, art activities, and many other delightfully creative gifts.

Sign up for our shops email newsletter to stay in the know about sales and new merch! Nonmembers will receive a welcome with 10% off your first online order. Members will receive a welcome with 20% off your first online order. Sign up today.
